response.answer_text: I take it you’ve seen Eilish’s video for “All the Good Girls Go to Hell”… and now you’re assuming she’s somehow “satanic”? Apparently that means she's also; ... a serial killer? (Bellyache) ... or the monster under your bed? (Bury a Friend) ... or a woman who jumped off a roof (Listen Before I Go) ... or an evil spider queen rising to power? (You Should See Me In a Crown) ... or a boy that got dumped (by Billie)? (8) ... or a mean-hearted, homewrecking woman? (Bad Guy) ... or a creepy stalker? (Hostage) Or is it perhaps more plausible that Billie writes a lot of fictional tales? I would think it’s quite obvious to everyone that has had a glance at her music catalog, that she writes from a LOT of different fictional character viewpoints? Probably half her music is pure fiction, and written as entertainment. Much of the rest is observational, and written from the viewpoint of someone other than herself (also kind of fictional). She’s a teenager and doesn’t have enough life experience to write a lot of deeply personal stories. She’s got maybe 2 or 3 songs that she’s claimed are actually about her personally. But somehow there are people who want to take an OBVIOUSLY fictional tale, and pretend it should be taken literally. And they’re using that as an excuse to get angry and forbid their kids from listening to her music. Just pathetic.

You bet she is demonic, satanic, and dangerously promote depression that may end in suicide. Read this - https://www.everydaychristianparent.com/billie-eilish-lyrics-bury-me-crown-suicide-demonic-meaning/
